intro: Coelorachis rottboellioides var. commutata, commonly known as the Commutated Coelorachis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
